intro: Altensteinia fiebrigii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight to flourish. Altensteinia fiebrigii is popular in horticulture for its ability to bloom throughout the year under proper care.
